Looking at Chart Values

Note: This topic applies to charting in the Windows client only.

The application's Chart window allows you to display or hide chart values for all charts. For certain types of charts, you can also use a reference-line cursor to see chart values and display a synopsis of chart values.

To display or hide values:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click the Options button on the Chart window toolbar. The Chart Properties dialog opens.

  3. Click the Series tab.

  4. Select the Show values check box to display chart values or clear it to hide them. To show values on charts with points, you must also check Point markers.

  5. Click OK.

    6. Note: To see the values only on charts with points, click the General tab and move the Point size slider to the far left.

To read a chart value by using the reference-line cursor:

  1. Display a chart.

  2. Click any non-movable part of a chart. X-axis and y-axis reference lines appear in the chart. These lines intersect at and pinpoint the location of the cursor.

  3. Move the cursor to any point, bar, or area to read its value.

To see a synopsis of data values:

    Double-click a slice, bar, or point in a pie or doughnut chart. This action displays a balloon displaying information on data values. For example, the balloon for a slice shows the numbers represented by the slice and the pie, along with the percentage for that ratio.
